reviews.review: trochę krótka ale spoko gra logicczna
Шедевр, просто шедевр !!!

Portal es un juego sencillo pero muy divertido e interesante. Parece que no tiene una historia muy compleja pero según lo juegas te das cuenta de que no es así. Tiene una gran jugabilidad y un precio bastante asequible. La única pega que le encuentro es que es un poco corto. En definitiva, me parece un gran juego.

I got this game on sale, along with portal 2. Fantastic game with a great storyline to follow along. All of the easter eggs and the simple beauty of the storyline make the game an incredible challenge and such a great time to play. The challenge maps and the additional content of the advanced chambers contribute so much more to the game as well. On sale the game is a sale, at no sale the game is still a worthy price point to this day!
10/10 would incinerate my companion cube again.

Portal was a lot of fun to play while it lasted
+Graphics have aged well and still is good visually
+Puzzles are a lot of fun and the physics and gaeplay in this game are remarkable
+A story that is not spoon fed to you until the very end. If you want to find things about the story you must look for it.
+ The narrations in this game were actually the highlight of my experience. It was both witty and funny and I actually enjoyed listening to what she said. 
-The game was to short even though its dense 3.5 hours isnt enough. 
-There was a large difficulty gap from one level to the next. 
-Had an abrupt ending that IMO felt rushed. 

Overall I really enjoyed this game and I cant wait to sink my teeth into Portal 2
8/10

Great game!

I actually bought just as a "warmup" for Portal 2, but still it was fun solving puzzles and throwing computers in Aperture Science offices :)

Another one of my favourites. I could play this game hundreds of times and still enjoy it. For a puzzle game, it does so much right. Even the story feels like a puzzle (one of the things 2 was really lacking). The puzzles are fun and get pretty hard (the first time around). This game is unforgettable. If you haven't played it, well, what have you been doing the past 7 years? Go play one of the best puzzle games you'll ever play, and play it again if you haven't played it in a while!
Loved it!

A little short for a game but i guess it's just me.
The puzzles are a whole lot of fun, they aren't too hard
so i don't think anyone would be frustrated with the game.
overall it's a good game and thinking with portals is pretty good fun :F

If you want a Newton-law defying game that alters phisics to its will, buy this game. It's worth it. In fact, buy the bundle for Portal and Portal 2. It will save a lot of time, and a decent amount of money.
Davvero bello!
One of the funniest and brilliant games I have ever played. 11/10
A classic puzzle game, definitely worth a pick-up whenever it goes on sale (which it does often). Funny characters, a neat short campaign, and some challenge maps.
Ce jeu est génial mais trés compliqué je le recommande pour les personnes qui aime les casse tete

This was a triumph!
I'm making a note here:
Huge success!

It's hard to overstate
my satisfaction.

Aperture Science:
We do what we must
because we can
For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying
over every mistake.
You just keep on trying
'til you run out of cake.
And the science gets done.
And you make a neat gun
for the people who are
still alive.

I'm not even angry...
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart,
and killed me.

And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because
I was so happy for you!

Now, these points of data
make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta.
We're releasing on time!
So I'm GLaD I got burned!
Think of all the things we learned!
for the people who are
still alive.

Go ahead and leave me...
I think I'd prefer to stay inside...
Maybe you'll find someone else
to help you.
Maybe Black Mesa?
That was a joke. Ha Ha. Fat Chance!

Anyway this cake is great!
It's so delicious and moist!

Look at me: still talking
when there's science to do!
When I look out there,
it makes me glad I'm not you.

I've experiments to run.
There is research to be done.
On the people who are
still alive.
And believe me I am
still alive.
I'm doing science and I'm
still alive.
I feel fantastic and I'm
still alive.
While you're dying I'll be
still alive.
And when you're dead I will be
still alive

Still alive.

Still alive.
I love this great little game - Completely unique and creative.... and I love CAKE!
Muy recomendado.

En general un excelente juego con unas buenas graficas y buena jugabilidad, altamente recomendado si te gustan los puzzles!

Get Portal 2, which is perfect in every way, but don't play the story until you get a chance to play and beat this.

O desempenho do jogo é muito bom, principalmente na versão linux, que com PCs mais modestos consegue rodar bem em placas da Intel (Onde se nota mais a diferença de plataformas).

Абсолютно потрясающая головоломка. Озвучка, диалоги, геймплей, сюжет, уровни, графика эпохальны. «Не забывайте, экспериментальный центр напоминает вам, что Вы - торт.» И в этом месте представляешь себе добрую улыбку разработчика с умными блестящими глазами. Пусть и Ваши мозги порадуются. Не отказывайте себе в этом!

"Portal" szybko wchodzi, schodzi i wychodzi, przez co niespełna 5-godzinny gameplay wciąga, ale nie pozostawia niesamowitego wrażenia i nie zachęca zbytnio do powrotu. Świetna gra, ale raczej na raz.

I seriously can't even begin to say how much I recommend this game. The Portal series (Portal and Portal 2) is honestly the best series I've ever played and it will probably stay like that for a long, long time. The stroyline is just amazing, you're immediately caught in this world of advanced technology and you will just want to play on and on. As a brief summary of this game here's a quote from a massive portal fan (me): "This game is definately worth buying even if it's not on sale. But if you're going to get Portal, why not get Portal 2? If you like sci-fi you'll [i]love[/i] this. And even if you don't, still buy it."

TL;DR: Buy it. Now. Even if you have no money just disobey the laws of mathematics and buy it. Why are you still reading?!

Now buy it.

Já ouviram a frase "Old, but gold"?É exatamente isso o que Portal é, ele apresenta ao jogador uma física sem igual, uma história muito interessante e uma trilha sonora EXCELENTE.Os gráficos ainda hoje é considerado bom  e todo amante de puzzle é OBRIGADO  a conferir Portal.

Madre mía de mi vida... mira que hora es! Si, eso fue lo que pensé cuando pude despegar los ojos de la pantalla después de jugar al Portal. Bueno, esto nos ha pasado a todos pero es que pude separarme del ordenador no porque se fuera la luz (tengo un SAI XD) o porque mi madre y/o novia me estuvieran fustigando para que lo dejara (ya pasan todos de mi XD) sino porque se termino el juego. Bromas aparte, no soy de los que se suelen terminar un juego del tirón y con este he estado 4 horas delante de el y para mi que llevaba minutos.

Entrando en el juego en si (aunque a estas alturas casi todo el mundo sepa de que va) explicare un poco la dinamica:

Todo comienza cuando te despiertas y una voz robótica te guia (mas o menos...) por unas misteriosas instalaciones osea, que es una incógnita todo. La susodicha ordenata se llama GLaDOS y te enseña a usar una pistola que crea portales tipo agujero de gusano entre dos superficies. Un portal es azul y otro naranja de forma que cuando caminas hacia un portal azul, apareces en el lugar donde colocaste el portal naranja y viceversa. Con este aparatito deberás resolver puzzles que pondrán a prueba tu lógica donde además tendrás que tener en cuenta la gravedad y la inercia. También deberas ocuparte de los únicos enemigos que encontraras, unas graciosas torretas. Con la ayuda de esta pistolita debes ir avanzando quebrándote la cabeza de camino, lo mejor de este juego es que en ningún momento te sientes aburrido u frustrado (yo soy mu de frustrarme con los puzles sobre todo si hay cronometro de por medio) a pesar de poder estar media hora para poder salir de una habitación.

En cuanto a los gráficos nada que decir muy buenos para su época (usa motor Sourse de HL2: Episode ), cualquiera que me conozca sabe que para mi lo primero de un juego no son los gráficos, pero si valoro mucho el apartado artístico y en Portal hicieron un gran trabajo en la creación de los escenarios.

El apartado musical es bueno, un poco repetitivo, pero apenas te fijas en ella porque va acompañando la historia de forma sutil, complementándose a la perfección. Sin duda alguna hay dos cosas que nunca olvidare de este juego, la primera es GLaDOS, para mi uno de los mejores personajes de videojuego que existe. Su voz, su sarcasmo, ironía y humor son inolvidables. La otra cosa especial es.... bueno me da un poco de pudor.... este juego ha conseguido que me enamore de un personaje ficticio... seria algo "normal" si no fuera porque el personaje es un cubo del tamaño de un horno que ni habla ni na de na.... jajajajaja y luego me hacen matarlo (dos de las cuatro horas de juego me las pase llorando XD) ¡Te odio GLaDOS!.

Todo no va a ser bonito claro, para mi lo malo es lo corto que se hace la historia (gran parte de la culpa la tiene también el jueguecito, si te aburrieras no te lo comerías de un tirón y seria más largo jajaja). de todas formas yo prefiero bueno y poco que mucho y malo (aunque si fuera bueno y mucho mejor claro).

Quitando esto el juego vale cada céntimo que te puedas gastar, buena historia, excelente jugabilidad, 0 bugs, muy muy pulido, momentos muy graciosos con frases muy muy épicas que quedaran para la historia de los videojuegos... Si es corto, pero tiene los mejores créditos que he visto en mi vida, joder me dio casi mas pena que terminaran los créditos que el juego (no es broma ya vereis si jugáis).

En fin, si amas los videojuegos tienes que jugar esta saga si o si. Yo otro día iré a por el 2, hoy no que si no me tienen que poner una vía con suero glucosado...

Ya me callo que me he pasao escribiendo, solo comprarlo, jugad y solo recordad una cosa:

"The cake is a lie"

Portal

I've been through Portal twice and it is quite the experience. When talking to my friends, I have used the word insane to describe it. The game wants a few of things from you. Problem solving, dexterity, and to be quick. As you travel through one room to the next you may need only one of these tools, but there will be times you will need all of them to find the solution. Now in my sixties, I wondered if I still had good enough hand and eye coordination. I guess I have enough, because I got through the game. Younger people will probably do better then I did. It becomes obvious the games intention is to get your brains juices flowing, which is good for young minds. How often did I turn to find myself spinning past the opening I wanted to go through and thus losing the precious time needed to complete the task; I lost count. 

There are two phases to the game. The first is a series of tests a computer program will talk you through and the second is a dark side that will remain mostly unspoken of, because that is part of the fun of this game and for the people who have no knowledge of this it would be a spoiler to mention to much of this. It actually is where the game becomes the most fun. Just know that the computer will not be helping you, remember Hal from the film "2001 a Space Odyssey", and to keep an eye on the walls for painted directions to tell you where you need to continue in your journey. 

As you travel from dilemma to dilemma, you need to remember that you can squat and leap, besides just walking. You would be surprised how far you can leap from a standing position. You will being doing these a lot, so keep them in mind as you ponder a solution to the problems you face. You will also find yourself standing on moving objects. Be prepared to leap on to things as they move past you.

As I stated above, the game requires problem solving and good hand and eye coordination, I personally feel this would be good for someone at the age of twelve or above. As I said, there is a dark side to the game, so be aware of this for younger children. It is not that serious, but each parent has to judge for themselves what their child is ready for.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game. There were times I over-thought the solution, when something very simple was required and I would face palm myself for not seeing the clear path I needed, but that is part of the game. I will end by telling you two things. Besides the portal gun, there will be devices in some of the rooms you can use to your advantage and their use is required. Making quick saves after ever little endeavor will save going back over accomplishments you don't need to go through more then once.

The games is short, but very enjoyable. Wait for a sale. I got it in a package deal with Portal 2, which I have yet to play. I feel if the game were longer it would become tedious, so I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

Una clara demostracion de lo que realmente significa un juego, buena jugabilidad, reto y ambiente, Portal me dio un par de horas de diversión y aun por lo corto que sea el juego en si, goze cada segundo y prueba que se me dio, me encantaba la relacion de los unicos y principales personajes y todas las dinamicas que habia, sin duda tambien me encanto su maravilloso humor. Recomendado, si tienes pc portal no debe faltarte.

Portal non è un semplice gioco, è qualcosa di più. 

A partire dalla trama emozionante, la quale vi prenderà dall'inizio. Non è uno di quei soliti puzzle game con storie a caso il cui unico scopo è risolvere l'enigma, al contrario. Dal primo minuto di gioco inizierete a pensare "E adesso cosa sucede? Come finirà? Da cosa è partito tutto questo?". Ha una storyline completa seppur non dia molti dettagli esplicitamente, ma che vi fa scoprire pian piano tutto quanto. Partirete in "medias res", per usare un termine specifico, cioè nel mezzo della storia, senza sapere nulla. E divorerete il gioco in un fiato per scoprire il perché di tutto quello che succede.

La grafica è semplicemente spettacolare per un gioco così leggero che richiede specifiche molto basse. Luci, colori, dettagli sono peretti. Non aspettatevi nulla di simile agli ultimi giochi usciti, al 4k o cose così, ma potrebbe tenergli testa considerando il rapporto qualità/specifiche.

Gameplay entusiasmante interamente basato sulla fisica e sulle abilità. Non c'è nulla di sempplificato, nessun suggerimento. Siete solo voi con la vostra Portal Gun e un carico di ingegno per superare le varie stanze. All'inizio può sembrare facile, ma man mano che si va avanti sarà sempre più difficile. E nonostante il gioco in sé può essere completato in 2-3 ore, è reso molto più longevo dai complicati achievement di Steam. E poi, personalmente trovo divertente rigiocare le mappe solo per sperimentare nuove vie e nuovi metodi risolutivi.

Altro punto a favore è che non sono presenti nemici (a parte alcune torrette che però fanno solo parte del puzzle) o boss da sconfiggere ad ogni livello (a parte quello finale, anche se lo si dovrà battere sempre attraverso un puzzle). Non è il solito gioco che dopo la terza volta che lo rifai ti stufa. È molto più di un semplice puzzle game.

In sintesi, se cercate un gioco che vi faccia ragionare, ma allo stesso tempo vi emozioni e vi prenda tanto da volerlo finire in una volta sola, Portal è la risposta! [spoiler]Insieme a una fetta di torta.[/spoiler]

And so it begins...... While this game is technically a continuation of Half Life, that doesn't matter in the slightest. 'Portal' is the beginning of its own franchise and does not dissapoint in any aspect. The game's incredibly innovative 'Portal Gun' system, the amazing background and characters, and the now famous cake. Combines to form a fantastic all-round atmospheric experience. A brilliant story-driven puzzle game (with a nice dose of action splashed in) and ultimately, in my opinion, Valve's best work so far. And the sequel's even better.......

Portal is always a good time – short but so very sweet!  The music and sounds, though subtle, are good and work well with the game’s somewhat drab, industrial/clinical environments (but they’re supposed to be given the setting of Aperture’s testing facility).  At times I even found the environment, paired with just the right amount of ambient music, vaguely unsettling with a definite ‘creep out’ factor and though this isn’t that kind of game, nor is it supposed to be that kind of game, you’ll gain a better understanding of why that is once you progress further in the game and learn what is supposed to happen to the test subjects, as well as discovering the scrawling of former test subjects in out of the way places along the way.  

Of course Portal is overall much more lighthearted in orientation, with an absurd sense of humor that never disappoints (case in point: turrets actually talk and even scream as you knock them down or drop them off a ledge, etc.).  As is often the case with platformer/puzzle games, there is little ‘wiggle’ room as far as how you go about completing the games various test chambers but to an extent there is an easier vs. more difficult method, and the game’s REAL main character, the ingenious portal gun, allows you to go about figuring out the best means of doing so to awesome effect!  There are even advanced test chamber challenges to try out along with bonus challenges, such as time trial and using the least amount of portals to progress through a particular test chamber, to add replay value.  

Also, there are of course Steam achievements and trading cards to unlock/add to your collection and there is controller support as well.  What’s not to like about this game; truly original, a game that was instantly deemed a ‘classic’ upon its release.

Portal on paper is a puzzle type game played in the first person. This simple description simply doesn't do it justice. The game's title is pretty upfront about what the game itself entails which is the use of portals. The use of portals may seem like something familiar but, the casual use of portals in the first person view introduces a whole different dimension when it comes to navigating yourself in the game, as well as introducing a whole new concept or approach to solving problems.

As intimidatingly complicated as it may seem when watching someone else play the game, it's hard to admit not to be intrigued yourself. When your brain finally manages to wrap itself around the concept and application of portals, it's every bit as gratifying being able to pull off complicated maneuvers yourself. The game not only has both the problem-solving and creative sides working together, but also leaves them hungry for more playtime in Portal.

Portal also manages to accomplish having a massive and compelling storyline despite telling it in such a subtle and minimal fashion.
Eh... mais ou menos, mais ou menos, mas não posso dizer que não gosto e the cake is a lie.
Great puzzle game with interesting story and eerie atmosphere
Obra Maestra.
Jedna z lepszych gier logicznych. Dużo zabawy przy robieniu map oraz testowaniu ich ;p
relatívne krátka, ale veľmi zábavná

Me encantó el juego, la verdad nunca había jugado nada parecido, te hace pensar y realmente quebrarte la cabeza en algunos niveles para completarlos, sobre todo en los últimos, pero si está bastante interesante y tiene buenos gráficos, incluso en mi computadora que no creo que sea tan potente, conseguí que corriera el juego. Muy recomendable, si lo quieren probar, primero descarguen el demo, así le hice yo, para saber si mi laptop sería capaz de correrlo. Ya jugándolo pase el demo y me decidí a comprar la versión completa, que realmente creo que vale mucho la pena. Ya sólo estoy ahorrando para comprarme el Portal 2, que se ve que está mejor todavía, pèro no se aún si mi compu lo soporte.

Muy recomendable 100%
